channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: New SG Digital Office to encourage digitalisation, starting with hawkers, seniors
item.description:
May 31, 2020 1:50 PM

1,000 digital ambassadors will be recruited by the end of June to help stallholders and seniors learn how to use digital tools.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 31
item.description:
May 31, 2020 8:05 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, May 31.

item.title: Singapore ends Covid-19 circuit breaker: How does it affect you from June 2
item.description:
May 31, 2020 6:00 AM

Here's a list of what is allowed under Phase 1 which starts on Tuesday.Â

item.title: New measures for foreign workers resuming work
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Staggered pick-up and drop-off times along with enhanced contact tracing measures were among a list of requirements that employers and dormitory operators have to fulfil before their foreign workers can return to work after June 1, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19 has stressed social fault lines in S'pore: Grace Fu
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 outbreak has stressed Singapore's social fault lines and increased tensions between foreigners and locals, Culture, Community and Youth Minister Grace Fu said at a dialogue on race yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Companies are short of manpower, workers miss their loved ones
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

On Tuesday, when Singapore moves into the first phase of reopening the economy following the circuit breaker, renovation contractor Alloyious Koh can start work again.

item.title: Robertson Quay breaches: Seven to be charged with flouting rules
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Six men and a woman, aged between 30 and 52, will be charged in court on Tuesday for flouting circuit breaker regulations.

item.title: Coronavirus: Malaysian worker in S'pore can't get home for his mother's funeral
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

As his siblings gathered around his mother's coffin for their last prayers, Mr Terry Mariyadas, 35, could only watch helplessly from the other end of a WhatsApp video call.

item.title: 3 new inmates and nurse at Changi Prison tested positive for virus in past 2 months
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Three inmates, who had been newly admitted into prison, and a staff nurse working at the Changi Prison Complex had tested positive for Covid-19 in the past two months.

item.title: Coronavirus: Travel curbs see fewer trucks crossing S'pore-Malaysia border
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

These days, Malaysian lorry driver Muhammad Rizwan Muhammad sets off for Singapore at 7am and is able to make it back to his home in Johor Baru in time for lunch.

item.title: What you can and cannot do from Tuesday
Safeguards as foreign workers return to work
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers staying in dormitories, their employers and dorm operators will have to comply with a slew of measures before the workers can resume work.

item.title: Duke-NUS grads take Hippocratic Oath in virtual ceremony
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

He was a naval officer for eight years and last held the position of officer commanding of a naval helicopter squadron.

item.title: Covid-19 cases visited food centres, supermarket outlets
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Several supermarket outlets and food centres were added to a list of places visited by Covid-19 patients before they were tested.

item.title: ST colouring contest winners show strokes of ingenuity
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Using only a few shades of colour pencils but a stellar amount of creativity, 10-year-old Wendy Lee completed an artwork that won her a $500 cash prize in The Straits Times "In This Together" Daily Colouring Challenge.

item.title: Why S'pore cannot cut down on foreign workers the way other countries have
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Is Singapore prepared to have 2,500 babies born here every year grow up to be construction workers?

item.title: Muis reiterates integrity of halal certification process following allegations
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

The Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis) has said that it has not been approached by the Corrupt Practices Investigation Bureau (CPIB) in connection with any investigations, refuting allegations published in different foreign media.

item.title: Singapore in talks with Australia, S. Korea on 'green lanes' for travel
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

Talks are under way with South Korea and Australia to establish "green lanes" for travel in the Covid-19 environment, said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: Everyone is a Covid-19 circuit breaker
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

In two days, the Covid-19 circuit breaker period will be over - in name, at least - bringing to a close a 56-day stretch that will long be remembered as among the most trying periods the country has had to face.

item.title: Announcement on F1 race to be made this week
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

The fate of the Formula One race in Singapore this year will be made known soon.

item.title: Getting riled up by neighbours' cigarette smoke, noise and litter during circuit breaker
Firms step up safety measures as more employees head back to work
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

With more employees heading back to on-site work this week, companies are taking steps to prevent exposure to the virus both within and outside the office.

item.title: The day food delivery services left tummies growling
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

In the middle of this month, many Singaporeans took part in the Hunger Games. And by that, I do not mean challenging Katniss Everdeen to a fight but, instead, we were left hungry while waiting for food to arrive late or not at all.

item.title: $13b secured to create thousands of jobs: Chan
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of $13 billion in investment commitments has been secured by Singapore in the first four months of this year - among the highest in recent years. This will create thousands of jobs in areas such as electronics, energy and chemicals.

item.title: Schools preparing to reopen on June 2: How do you keep kids away from one another or make them wear masks?
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

How do you keep active five-and six-year-olds away from one another? Or ensure the masks they have to wear stay on?

item.title: Businesses know they must play a waiting game after circuit breaker ends
item.description:
May 31, 2020 5:00 AM

For three years, Mr Dylan Ong, owner of The Masses restaurant, which is known for its Asian-inspired French cuisine, had resisted providing a delivery option for customers who wanted to eat at home or at work. He believed food tasted best when eaten freshly prepared and on site at his Beach Road eatery.
